trans-unit.source: Use Windows PowerShell to manage MySQL Database on Azure – Azure cloud
trans-unit.target: Use Windows PowerShell to manage MySQL Database on Azure – Azure cloud

trans-unit.source: This article explains how to use Windows PowerShell to do more with MySQL Database on Azure, including create, view, delete, and modify operations.
trans-unit.target: This article explains how to use Windows PowerShell to do more with MySQL Database on Azure, including create, view, delete, and modify operations.

trans-unit.source: Use Windows PowerShell to manage MySQL Database on Azure
trans-unit.target: Use Windows PowerShell to manage MySQL Database on Azure

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.SELECTOR]
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.SELECTOR]

trans-unit.source: Chinese Version
trans-unit.target: Chinese Version

trans-unit.source: English Version
trans-unit.target: English Version

trans-unit.source: This white paper explains how to use PowerShell to do more with MySQL Database on Azure, including create, view, delete, and modify operations.
trans-unit.target: This white paper explains how to use PowerShell to do more with MySQL Database on Azure, including create, view, delete, and modify operations.

trans-unit.source: We recommend that you first read [Using Azure Resource Manager and PowerShell to deploy and use MySQL Database on Azure](/documentation/articles/mysql-database-etoe-powershell).
trans-unit.target: We recommend that you first read [Using Azure Resource Manager and PowerShell to deploy and use MySQL Database on Azure](/documentation/articles/mysql-database-etoe-powershell).

trans-unit.source: This article explains how to download and use PowerShell, and how to use it to quickly create a MySQL Database on Azure data services.
trans-unit.target: This article explains how to download and use PowerShell, and how to use it to quickly create a MySQL Database on Azure data services.

trans-unit.source: Before you begin, ensure that you have properly prepared PowerShell.
trans-unit.target: Before you begin, ensure that you have properly prepared PowerShell.

trans-unit.source: Contents
trans-unit.target: Contents

trans-unit.source: Understanding Azure Resource Manager templates and resource groups
trans-unit.target: Understanding Azure Resource Manager templates and resource groups

trans-unit.source: Operations: Create
trans-unit.target: Operations: Create

trans-unit.source: Operations: View
trans-unit.target: Operations: View

trans-unit.source: Operations: Modify
trans-unit.target: Operations: Modify

trans-unit.source: Operations: Delete
trans-unit.target: Operations: Delete

trans-unit.source: 1. Understand Azure Resource Manager templates and resource groups
trans-unit.target: 1. Understand Azure Resource Manager templates and resource groups

trans-unit.source: Most apps that are deployed and run on Azure are built from combinations of different types of cloud resources.
trans-unit.target: Most apps that are deployed and run on Azure are built from combinations of different types of cloud resources.

trans-unit.source: Azure Resource Manager templates allow you to centralize the deployment and management of these different resources, so that all you need to do is complete a JavaScript Object Notation (JSON) description of the resources and the associated configuration and deployment parameters.
trans-unit.target: Azure Resource Manager templates allow you to centralize the deployment and management of these different resources, so that all you need to do is complete a JavaScript Object Notation (JSON) description of the resources and the associated configuration and deployment parameters.

trans-unit.source: 1\.1 Understand resource type parameter information in MySQL Database on Azure
trans-unit.target: 1\.1 Understand resource type parameter information in MySQL Database on Azure

trans-unit.source: Six resource types are currently defined in MySQL Database on Azure JSON files: servers, databases, users, privileges, firewall rules, and backups.
trans-unit.target: Six resource types are currently defined in MySQL Database on Azure JSON files: servers, databases, users, privileges, firewall rules, and backups.

trans-unit.source: Users can perform view, create, modify, and delete operations on these six resource types by using the Get, New, Set, and Remove commands.
trans-unit.target: Users can perform view, create, modify, and delete operations on these six resource types by using the Get, New, Set, and Remove commands.

trans-unit.source: Download the [JSON template file](http://wacnppe.blob.core.chinacloudapi.cn/marketing-resource/2015-09-01.json) to find out more about API parameter definitions for MySQL Database on Azure services.
trans-unit.target: Download the [JSON template file](http://wacnppe.blob.core.chinacloudapi.cn/marketing-resource/2015-09-01.json) to find out more about API parameter definitions for MySQL Database on Azure services.

trans-unit.source: 2. Operations: Create
trans-unit.target: 2. Operations: Create

trans-unit.source: The New command allows you to create MySQL servers, databases, users, user permissions, backups, and firewall rules.
trans-unit.target: The New command allows you to create MySQL servers, databases, users, user permissions, backups, and firewall rules.

trans-unit.source: 2.1 Create servers
trans-unit.target: 2.1 Create servers

trans-unit.source: Edit and run the following commands to set information, including your server name, location, version, and other details, in order to complete creating the server.
trans-unit.target: Edit and run the following commands to set information, including your server name, location, version, and other details, in order to complete creating the server.

trans-unit.source: 2\.2 Create server firewall rules
trans-unit.target: 2\.2 Create server firewall rules

trans-unit.source: Edit and run the following commands to set information, including your firewall rule names and IP whitelist range (start IP address and end IP address), in order to finish creating the firewall rules.
trans-unit.target: Edit and run the following commands to set information, including your firewall rule names and IP whitelist range (start IP address and end IP address), in order to finish creating the firewall rules.

trans-unit.source: 2\.3 Create databases
trans-unit.target: 2\.3 Create databases

trans-unit.source: Edit and run the following commands to set information, including your database name and character sets, in order to finish creating the database.
trans-unit.target: Edit and run the following commands to set information, including your database name and character sets, in order to finish creating the database.

trans-unit.source: 2\.4 Create users
trans-unit.target: 2\.4 Create users

trans-unit.source: Edit and run the following commands to set information, including your username and password, in order to finish creating the database.
trans-unit.target: Edit and run the following commands to set information, including your username and password, in order to finish creating the database.

trans-unit.source: 2\.5 Add user permissions
trans-unit.target: 2\.5 Add user permissions

trans-unit.source: Edit and run the following commands to assign database read/write permissions to users.
trans-unit.target: Edit and run the following commands to assign database read/write permissions to users.

trans-unit.source: Permissions can be either “Read” or “ReadWrite.”
trans-unit.target: Permissions can be either “Read” or “ReadWrite.”

trans-unit.source: 2\.6 Create on-demand backup files
trans-unit.target: 2\.6 Create on-demand backup files

trans-unit.source: Edit and run the following commands to set backup file names and create on-demand backup files.
trans-unit.target: Edit and run the following commands to set backup file names and create on-demand backup files.

trans-unit.source: 3. Operations: View
trans-unit.target: 3. Operations: View

trans-unit.source: Use the Get command to view lists such as current MySQL servers, databases, users, user permission, backups, and firewall rules.
trans-unit.target: Use the Get command to view lists such as current MySQL servers, databases, users, user permission, backups, and firewall rules.

trans-unit.source: You can also view detailed parameters and configurations.
trans-unit.target: You can also view detailed parameters and configurations.

trans-unit.source: 3\.1 View server lists
trans-unit.target: 3\.1 View server lists

trans-unit.source: Edit and run the following commands to view all the current server lists.
trans-unit.target: Edit and run the following commands to view all the current server lists.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE]**Unlike other commands, this checks that the “-ApiVersion 2015-01-01” in the server is directed at the Azure Resource Manager API, whereas this is “-ApiVersion 2015-09-01” in all other commands and is directed at the MySQL API.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE]**Unlike other commands, this checks that the “-ApiVersion 2015-01-01” in the server is directed at the Azure Resource Manager API, whereas this is “-ApiVersion 2015-09-01” in all other commands and is directed at the MySQL API.

trans-unit.source: 3\.2 View database lists and parameters
trans-unit.target: 3\.2 View database lists and parameters

trans-unit.source: Edit and run the following commands to view all database lists for a specific server in the current resource group.
trans-unit.target: Edit and run the following commands to view all database lists for a specific server in the current resource group.

trans-unit.source: 3\.3 View user lists and parameters
trans-unit.target: 3\.3 View user lists and parameters

trans-unit.source: Edit and run the following commands to view all user lists for a specific server in the current resource group.
trans-unit.target: Edit and run the following commands to view all user lists for a specific server in the current resource group.

trans-unit.source: 3\.4 View user permission lists and parameters
trans-unit.target: 3\.4 View user permission lists and parameters

trans-unit.source: Edit and run the following commands to view all user permissions for a specific database in the current resource group.
trans-unit.target: Edit and run the following commands to view all user permissions for a specific database in the current resource group.

trans-unit.source: 3\.5 View backup lists and parameters
trans-unit.target: 3\.5 View backup lists and parameters

trans-unit.source: Edit and run the following commands to view all backup files for a specific server in the current resource group.
trans-unit.target: Edit and run the following commands to view all backup files for a specific server in the current resource group.

trans-unit.source: 3\.6 View firewall rule lists and parameters
trans-unit.target: 3\.6 View firewall rule lists and parameters

trans-unit.source: Edit and run the following commands to view all firewall rules for a specific server in the current resource group.
trans-unit.target: Edit and run the following commands to view all firewall rules for a specific server in the current resource group.

trans-unit.source: 4. Operations: Modify
trans-unit.target: 4. Operations: Modify

trans-unit.source: Use the Set command to carry out configuration tasks, such as changing account passwords, modifying permissions, and altering certain server parameters.
trans-unit.target: Use the Set command to carry out configuration tasks, such as changing account passwords, modifying permissions, and altering certain server parameters.

trans-unit.source: 4\.1 Modify account passwords
trans-unit.target: 4\.1 Modify account passwords

trans-unit.source: Edit and run the following commands to change the password for a specific account.
trans-unit.target: Edit and run the following commands to change the password for a specific account.

trans-unit.source: 4\.2 Modify access permission for a particular user
trans-unit.target: 4\.2 Modify access permission for a particular user

trans-unit.source: Edit and run the following commands to modify the access permissions for a specific user.
trans-unit.target: Edit and run the following commands to modify the access permissions for a specific user.

trans-unit.source: 4\.3 Allow access for all Azure services
trans-unit.target: 4\.3 Allow access for all Azure services

trans-unit.source: Edit and run the following commands to allow all Azure services to access specific servers.
trans-unit.target: Edit and run the following commands to allow all Azure services to access specific servers.

trans-unit.source: 4\.4 Modify the default time for daily backups
trans-unit.target: 4\.4 Modify the default time for daily backups

trans-unit.source: Edit and run the following commands to change the default daily backup start time for a specific server.
trans-unit.target: Edit and run the following commands to change the default daily backup start time for a specific server.

trans-unit.source: The time can be set from 0 to 24, and means Beijing time UTC+8 in this location.
trans-unit.target: The time can be set from 0 to 24, and means Beijing time UTC+8 in this location.

trans-unit.source: 4\.5 Turn on slow query logs
trans-unit.target: 4\.5 Turn on slow query logs

trans-unit.source: Edit and run the following commands to turn on slow query logs.
trans-unit.target: Edit and run the following commands to turn on slow query logs.

trans-unit.source: 4\.6 Modify firewall rules
trans-unit.target: 4\.6 Modify firewall rules

trans-unit.source: Edit and run the following commands to alter the existing firewall rules.
trans-unit.target: Edit and run the following commands to alter the existing firewall rules.

trans-unit.source: 4\.7 Modify parts of the MySQL server settings
trans-unit.target: 4\.7 Modify parts of the MySQL server settings

trans-unit.source: Using the wait\_timeout parameter as an example, edit and run the following commands to change the default value for wait\_timeout.
trans-unit.target: Using the wait\_timeout parameter as an example, edit and run the following commands to change the default value for wait\_timeout.

trans-unit.source: See the JSON files for details of other parameters.
trans-unit.target: See the JSON files for details of other parameters.

trans-unit.source: Refer to the JSON file definitions below for details of how to modify other parameters.
trans-unit.target: Refer to the JSON file definitions below for details of how to modify other parameters.

trans-unit.source: See [Setting MySQL Database on Azure server parameters](/documentation/articles/mysql-database-advanced-settings) for details of valid parameter ranges:
trans-unit.target: See [Setting MySQL Database on Azure server parameters](/documentation/articles/mysql-database-advanced-settings) for details of valid parameter ranges:

trans-unit.source: 5. Operations: Delete
trans-unit.target: 5. Operations: Delete

trans-unit.source: Use the Remove command to delete MySQL servers, databases, users, backups, and firewall rules.
trans-unit.target: Use the Remove command to delete MySQL servers, databases, users, backups, and firewall rules.

trans-unit.target: 5\.1 Delete servers
